channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Fox News headed for trial, again, over 2020 election fraud claims
item.description: The defamation case brought by voting technology company Smartmatic against Fox News can proceed, a New York state appellate court rules.
item.content:encoded:
The defamation case brought by voting technology company Smartmatic against Fox News can proceed, a New York state appellate court rules.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: More than half a million students were out of school because of LA fires this week
item.description: School districts in and around Los Angeles shut down because of the fires. That includes LAUSD, the second largest school district in the country.
item.content:encoded:
School districts in and around Los Angeles shut down because of the fires. That includes LAUSD, the second largest school district in the country.

(Image credit: Jireh Deng for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: A small seafood restaurant turns into a national donation hub for LA fire victims
item.description: In response to the devastating fires raging in LA, a small restaurant in Surf City USA has become a channel for big help — from locals to people across the country — to support their neighbors up north.
item.content:encoded:
In response to the devastating fires raging in LA, a small restaurant in Surf City USA has become a channel for big help — from locals to people across the country — to support their neighbors up north.

(Image credit: Emma Bowman/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: New photos show the volcanic plains of Mercury after a spacecraft fly-by
item.description: The BepiColombo spacecraft flew less than 200 miles from Mercury's surface and photographed volcanic plains and icy craters.
item.content:encoded: The BepiColombo spacecraft flew less than 200 miles from Mercury's surface and photographed volcanic plains and icy craters.
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro begins new term as US raises arrest bounty
item.description: The US announces an increased $25 million reward for information leading to the arrest of Venezuelas President Maduro on day he's sworn in for a third term.
item.content:encoded:
The US announces an increased $25 million reward for information leading to the arrest of Venezuelas President Maduro on day he's sworn in for a third term.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: Is smoke in your home? Here's how to make an air purifier from a box fan
item.description: A large area of greater Los Angeles had unhealthy air Friday, due to particulate matter from large wildfires. Here are tips for breathing cleaner air indoors if it's smoky outside.
item.content:encoded:
A large area of greater Los Angeles had unhealthy air Friday, due to particulate matter from large wildfires. Here are tips for breathing cleaner air indoors if it's smoky outside.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Biden extends protections for immigrants from Venezuela, El Salvador and Ukraine
item.description: Close to a million migrants will be shielded from deportation for up to 18 months.
item.content:encoded:
Close to a million migrants will be shielded from deportation for up to 18 months.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: U.S. ambassador to Israel makes his final push for release of U.S. hostages from Gaza
item.description: "We are going to do everything we can in this round to get all the American hostages, living and dead, out," Ambassador Jacob J. Lew tells NPR. His tenure as President Biden's envoy ends this month.
item.content:encoded:
"We are going to do everything we can in this round to get all the American hostages, living and dead, out," Ambassador Jacob J. Lew tells NPR. His tenure as President Biden's envoy ends this month.

(Image credit: Maya Levin for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Canceled flights, stranded cars, no power: Winter storm slams swath of U.S.
item.description: Atlanta has seen nearly 1,000 flights grounded, while more than 34,000 Arkansans have lost power.
item.content:encoded:
Atlanta has seen nearly 1,000 flights grounded, while more than 34,000 Arkansans have lost power.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Nate Perez

item.title: 2024 was the hottest year on record. The reason remains a science mystery
item.description: The official numbers are in: 2024 is the hottest year on record. Climate change is the main culprit. But there might be something else going on, too.
item.content:encoded:
The official numbers are in: 2024 is the hottest year on record. Climate change is the main culprit. But there might be something else going on, too.

(Image credit: Selcuk Acar)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda
